function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"High degree of acceptability of intensive digital/virtual practices","Impact":"Increased loneliness, reduced productivity, unhealthy habits, potential obesity, and loss of benefits from reduced interactions","Mitigation":"Promote balanced digital use, foster social connections through virtual means, and encourage healthy lifestyle habits","Technologies":"Digital well-being apps, virtual social platforms, and remote work tools","People":"General public, employees, students","Owner":"Health organizations, educational institutions, employers"},{"Description":"Social and spatial implications of architects and planners examining the shift from physical to virtual","Impact":"Substantial changes in urban dynamics and socio-spatial implications","Mitigation":"Design flexible and adaptable built environments, promote mixed-use developments, and prioritize accessible green spaces","Technologies":"Smart city technologies, urban planning software, and sustainable architecture solutions","People":"Architects, planners, built environment professionals","Owner":"Urban planning authorities, architectural firms"},{"Description":"New living and working styles emerging post-pandemic","Impact":"Creation of new environments to accommodate changing lifestyles","Mitigation":"Explore flexible work arrangements, integrate technology in built environment design, and prioritize health and well-being in built environment planning","Technologies":"Remote work platforms, IoT devices for smart living, and health-focused building designs","People":"Workers, residents, urban dwellers","Owner":"Employers, urban planners, developers"}]}
